content.prompt: Nathan has been unable to trust banks since the failure of his savings and loan bank. He claims that storing his hard-earned money at home is costless. Is Nathan correct?

choices.label: Yes, because money is the most liquid form of financial assets.
Yes, because there is no opportunity cost in holding money.
Yes, because the opportunity cost of holding money is the real value of goods and services it can purchase.
No, because money is the least liquid form of financial assets.
No, because the opportunity cost of holding money is the lost interest he could have earned on other financial assets.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
